entry.title: Projects
entry.summary:
Here's a list of my open-source projects. Also on github.

Hadoop tooling

Although these tools are used in production, some of the repos would benefit from wrapping up.

  • Cornet - Command-line tool on top of Apache Sqoop to simplify ingestion of data from RDBMs to Hive.
  • odata2avro - Command-line tool to convert OpenData XML from Microsoft MarketPlace to Apache Avro files.
  • Impala REST API - Thin REST API for Impala with Redis caching (co-author)
  • wsdl2avro - Scala library to convert datatypes from a SOAP WSDL to Avro Schemas (advisor)
  • salesforce2hadoop - Import Salesforce data into Hadoop HDFS in Avro format (advisor)

Hadoop experimentation

  • Virtual Zookeper cluster - A 3-node virtual Apache Zookeper cluster with Vagrant, VirtualBox and Ansible
  • Kafka-Spark-Twitter-Scala - Example integration of Kafka, Avro and Spark-Streaming on live Twitter feed, written in Scala

Bank scraping

  • AirBank-tx - Download bank account transactions and read account balance from AirBank.cz internet banking (Selenium, headless Chrome, Docker)

For fun

  • Random text detector - Automatic detector of random text based on inverse-document-frequency
  • Fractal generator - Generator of Mandelbrot and Julia fractals written in Scala. This was my first Scala code. Now, I'd write it very differently :)
  • Propsort - Sort your Java/Scala/Play properties file according to a given template

entry.title: Talks
entry.summary:
Dec 2014: Hadoop in Practice (SDN Conference)

It was great fun talking at SDN about how we use Hadoop at TheNewMotion. The talk was mostly focused on the Business Intelligence aspect of our Hadoop stack and the Cloudera Hadoop Distribution that we use. Thanks to Daan for helping me preparing the talk.
